content: I am a Postdoctoral Fellow at Harvard University working with Mor Nitzan. My research interests lie in the application of mathematics to complex and biological systems. I am particularly interested in representation learning for the analysis of the single-cell RNA data. This analysis can reveal rare cell populations, regulatory relationships between genes, and track the trajectories of distinct cell lineages in development. Moreover, I am fascinated by the quickly developing reinforcement learning field. I investigated policy gradient and Q-learning algorithms at Microsoft Research after finishing my PhD in biophysics with Eric Lauga.
summary: I am a Postdoctoral Fellow at Harvard University working with Mor Nitzan. My research interests lie in the application of mathematics to complex and biological systems. I am particularly interested in representation learning for the analysis of the single-cell RNA data. This analysis can reveal rare cell populations, regulatory relationships between genes, and track the trajectories of distinct cell lineages in development. Moreover, I am fascinated by the quickly developing reinforcement learning field.
title: Justas Dauparas

content: What are disentangled representations? The recent paper “Towards a Definition of Disentangled Representations” lays out a mathematical definition using group and representation theory.
summary: What are disentangled representations? The recent paper “Towards a Definition of Disentangled Representations” lays out a mathematical definition using group and representation theory.
title: Disentangled Representations

summary: We show that Q-learning with nonlinear Q-function and no explicit exploration can learn several standard benchmark tasks.
title: Depth and nonlinearity induce implicit exploration

summary: We discovered that motile cells in sessile colonies of peritrichously flagellated bacteria can self-organize into motile bands that can drive long-range fluid transport at a constant speed of ~30 Î¼m/s, providing a stable high-speed avenue for material transport at the colony scale.
title: Self-organization of swimmers drives long-range fluid transport in bacterial colonies (submitted)

summary: My PhD work on Stokes flows near boundaries.
title: Stokes flows near boundaries: bacteria, corners, and pumps (PhD thesis)

summary: Theoretical and experimental work on understanding leading-order Stokes flows near a 3D corner.
title: Leading-order Stokes flows near a corner

summary: The rotation of a helical bacterial flagellum induces both a force and a torque on the surrounding fluid, both of which lead to a net flow along the surface.
title: Helical micropumps near surfaces

summary: We explain the systematic chiral flow in the clockwise direction ahead of the bacterial swarm.
title: Flagellar flows around bacterial swarms
